title: BADecker
author: BADecker
content: Countries of Europe are starting to wake up to the fact of their loss in fighting Russia. Since the various governments are all about money, it will be the people who will push this through... like the French Revolution all over again. Many links in the article below.France And Germany Threaten Biden After Putin Warns "No One Can Sit Out The Coming Storm"Quote from: https://www.rumormillnews.com/cgi-bin/forum.cgi?read=210287An informative new Security Council (SC) report circulating in the Kremlin today first noting President Putin factually assessing during his milestone Valdai speech: "No once can sit out the coming storm", says during his observation that the world stands at the precipice of a tumultuous decade that will bring the most danger and unpredictability in several generations as Western hegemony inevitably draws to a close, he also warned: "We are standing on a historic frontier...Ahead is probably the most dangerous, unpredictable and, at the same time, important decade since the end of World War II"—a warning followed by moderator Fyodor Lukyanov inquiring of President Putin: "We grew a bit worried remembering your comments made here four years ago when you said that we would all go to heaven in the event of a nuclear apocalypse…We're not in a hurry to get there, are we?"—President Putin stayed silent for a couple of seconds, as some audience members laughed, then the moderator broke the silence by stating: "Now that you are lost in thought it's getting alarming"---in reply President Putin laughed and said: "I intentionally got lost in thought to alarm you...The effect has been achieved".Also alarmed about the looming threat of a nuclear apocalypse, this report notes, is socialist Western colonial leader French President Emmanuel Macron, who this week rushed to the Vatican and pleaded with Pope Francis to urge Supreme Socialist Leader Joe Biden to start negotiations to end the conflict in Ukraine—a plea for peace the socialist Biden Regime responded to by saying that it "sees no prospects for negotiations" between Russia and Ukraine and that it's up to Ukrainian President Vladimir Zelensky to "decide when talks will happen", which it knows will never happen because President Zelensky passed a law outlawing any talks with Russia—then in a stunning strategy reversal, yesterday the Pentagon announced it would no longer rule out the use of nuclear weapons against a non-nuclear threat....
